content: ben s mitts by dana nelms these simple fingerless mitts will keep even the busiest hands warm knit using the hardy and rustic isle yarns dk poll dorset wool the mitts will naturally soften with wear and wash and surely become ones you reach for again and again the farrow rib patterning creates a lofty and stretchy mitt well suited for women and men the mitts went on a trial run with ben and passed the test whether working on the farm photographing the countryside or hiking the globe his hands were kept toasty warm materials isle yarns poll dorset wool one skein 220m / 238 yds color mizzens 5mm / us8 or size to obtain gauge circular needle for magic loop or double point needles waste yarn darning needle size medium - hand circumference of 20-25 cm/8-10 in these mitts can be easily sized by reducing or increasing your cast on by 3 stitches gauge 26 sts per 10cm/4in in farrow rib abbreviations pm - place marker sl - slip marker k - knit p - purl m1l - make one left m1r - make one right k2tog - knit two stitchs together pattern cuff co 45 stitches pm and join in round rounds 1-18 *k2 p1* repeat to end of round setup for thumb gusset round 19 k2 p1 k1 pm m1l k1 p1 k1 m1r pm k1 p1 *k2 p1* repeat ** to end of round round 20 k1 p2 k1 sm keep in *k2 p1* rib until next marker sm k1 p1 *k1 p2* to end of round note the hand is worked in farrow rib while the thumb is worked in *k2 p1* rib hand and thumb gusset round 21 k2 p1 k1 sm m1l keep in established *k2 p1* rib to next marker m1r sm k1 p1 *k2 p1* repeat ** to end of round round 22 k1 p2 k1 sm keep in *k2 p1* rib until next marker sm p2 *k1 p2* to end of round repeat rounds 21 and 22 until there are 17 stitches between markers repeat rounds 21and 22 three times more without increasing round 23 k2 p1 k1 place 17 stitches on waste yarn cast on 3 stitches using preferred method k1 p1 *k2 p1* repeat ** to end of round round 24 *k1 p2* repeat to end of round farrow rib round 25 *k2 p1* repeat to end of round round 26 *k1 p2* repeat to end of round repeat rounds 24 and 25 nine times more or until approximately one inch shorter than desired length rounds 26 - 35 *k2 p1* repeat to end of round bobble loosley in pattern thunb place 17 gusset stitches back onto needles with new yarn pick up 4 stitches then proceed with established *k2 p1* until end of round repeat *k2 p1* round until desired length bind off in pattern using tail from joining new yarn stitch closed any gap at base of thumb weave in ends repeat for second mitt
